messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] New Samurai Archives Section
messages.msgSnippet: Hey. I just didn t know it had existed. That post I didn t open, but have now seen it.  The least I can say is impressive.  Very impressive.  L8r. Tim
messages.messageBody:
Hey.
I just didn't know it had existed. That post I didn't open, but have now
seen it. The least I can say is "impressive. Very impressive." L8r.

Tim

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] New Samurai Archives Section
messages.msgSnippet: On Thu, 24 Jun 2004 04:37:06 -0000, Kitsuno$B$5$s(B wrote in message  ... Since no one else has reacted, let me say that this is a
messages.messageBody:
On Thu, 24 Jun 2004 04:37:06 -0000, Kitsunoさん wrote in message <cbdlpi+ous4@...>
>The "Sengoku Era Ranks and Titles" section has just been uploaded to
>the Samurai Archives website:
>
>http://www.samurai-archives.com/title.html
>
>It is by no means complete, but is a good solid start. Due to
>logistical problems over the next few months I don't expect to add to
>it until a much later date, but enjoy!

Since no one else has reacted, let me say that this is a very cool
page. Thanks!

I'd love to see a bit more on the ritsuryou system in general - my
current fetish - and where the titles came from to begin with, there
general hierarchy, etc. But it must already have taken a ton of work
to pull together what you have there.

--
Jay Kelly
oyakata@...

messages.subject: New Samurai Archives Section
messages.msgSnippet: The Sengoku Era Ranks and Titles section has just been uploaded to the Samurai Archives website: http://www.samurai-archives.com/title.html It is by no means
messages.messageBody:
The "Sengoku Era Ranks and Titles" section has just been uploaded to
the Samurai Archives website:

http://www.samurai-archives.com/title.html

It is by no means complete, but is a good solid start. Due to
logistical problems over the next few months I don't expect to add to
it until a much later date, but enjoy!

KITSUNO
Webmaster
